channel.title: Welcome! on Joy+Full
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome! on Joy+Full

item.title: Cold Noodle Soup
item.description: This refreshing icy cold noodle soup will cool you off from heat while you are enjoying the savory, peppery and sweet savor in your mouth. These last 3 days have been epic hot in WA.

item.title: Puget Sound (Totten Inlet, Shelton)
item.description: We learned that our friends from NYC were planning to visit her family in Portland soon. They said they would have extra time to catch up with us. They both are fully vaccinated and they felt safe enough to make a long overdue visit to her family.

item.title: Curried Cauliflower Sandwich
item.description: This simple yet flavorful sandwich will make your mouth watery on your first bite. This can be great for a lunch box or for a picnic lunch. I didn't know much about cauliflower growing up.

item.title: Where'd you go Bernadette
item.description: I've been reading self improvement/personal growth books mainly. I wanted to read a fiction to relax and enjoy for weekends to reward myself after my routine week. When my friend, Marzena, messaged me to send a book that she read to share with me, I was grateful and excited.

item.title: Salt and Pepper Jumbo Shrimp Salad
item.description: This fresh green, warm sweet cooked vegetable toppings and chewy-popping shrimps along with spicy jalapeño will fill your mouth full of satisfaction. I had this salad in a Japanese restaurant in Park slope, Brooklyn, NY.

item.title: Leaders Eat Last
item.description: Somehow I didn't have much expectation on this book. I thought this book was about just simply leaders being sacrificial, responsible or considerate to their people and nothing more. This book in fact, provided me much more insights, thoughts and information than I expected.

item.title: Avocado Salad
item.description: This creamy, tangy/briney and aromatic salad is a great dinner company along with a nice toasted bread and grilled chicken pieces. *This recipe is based on NYT cooking. This story is about MY experience of the recipe.

item.title: Lake Ketchum
item.description: I love traveling. Traveling makes me refreshed, opens new views to the world and people. It has been a while since Covid-19 started. We stopped all trips including family visiting.

item.title: Good to Great
item.description: After finishing The 5AM Club, I was pumped in high spirit and wanted to read another self development book. I wanted more inspiration. I went through my library in Audible and this book caught my eye.

item.title: Gwyneth x Brené Brown On the Root of Shame, Courage and Vulnerability
item.description: I listened to "Gwyneth x Brené Brown: On the Roots of Shame, Courage, and Vulnerability" in Apr 2019 right before listening to "The Anatomy of Trust". I became a super fan of Dr.

item.title: Educated
item.description: I read this book in the middle of year 2020. I've been hearing and seeing the title through media, bookstores and word of mouth. It has been some time since I read this book but I still remember the feeling of difficulties to swallow series of incidents happened in the book that sounded like a movie.

item.title: Blink
item.description: I picked this book out of curiosity when searching the next book to read after The 5AM Club. It was my husband who said about the book being interesting to read on how we make our decision in a moment without noticing.

item.title: Chicken Tacos
item.description: This basic and simple chicken tacos are great for summer lunch. I love Mexican food. It has lots of ingredients that I like. Avocados, peppers, jalapeños, corns, beans, tortillas and more.

item.title: Smoked Salmon Salad
item.description: This light but satisfying nutritious balanced Smoked Salmon Salad will savor you up with peppery arugula, buttery and smokey salmon, and creamy yet light sour cream. I like simple dinner just because it helps me sleep well and feel good in the morning.

item.title: The Anatomy of Trust
item.description: I listened to "Oprah Super Soul Conversations:The Anatomy of Trust" from Dr. Brené Brown about 2 years ago and I still remember how strongly that hit me about trust.

item.title: Lemony Shrimp Bean Stew
item.description: It was a great ending with this Lemony Shrimp Bean Stew for Valentine's dinner. I loved it. So did my husband and kids. We all dug in this stew with a toasted tuscan pane bread.

item.title: Maple Baked Salmon
item.description: It was a good start with this Maple Baked Salmon for Valentine's lunch. It was salmon melting in your mouth experience. I served with a piece of lemon wedge and baked fingerings.

item.title: The 5AM Club
item.description: I recently read The 5AM Club. This book was recommended by my friend (thanks, Amanda!). It was interesting, motivating and inspiring to read. I would like to recite some of quotes from the book that inspired, motivated and moved me.

item.title: Vegetarian Bibimbab
item.description: This Vegetarian Bibimbab, simple salads over rice is easy and light yet satisfying. It is a great meal for dinner. Bibimbab is one of popular korean dishes. "Bibim" means mixed and "

item.title: Fish Burrito Bowl
item.description: This fluffy, flavorful, flakey and with a little kick of spicyfish burrito bowl is what summer lunches are all about! I love burrito for it's flavorful ingredients and its chewy tortilla.

item.title: About
item.description: About Me, Joy Oh Hello and Welcome to Joy+Full! I'm Joy: a food lover, a bird lover and a minimalist, idealist, eager persona. I'm currently living in Redmond, WA with my 2 cheerful and lovely kids and amazing husband.

item.title: Food
item.description: Welcome to Joy's Kitchen

item.title: Monologue
item.description: Welcome to Joy's Doodle Space!

item.title: travel
item.description: Enjoy Your Time Off
